report from speaker_A, thesis proposal,: 'speaker_A': 'uh, week an or two, I've been just writing my, uh, formal thesis proposal.'
'speaker_A': 'Um, so I'm taking this qualifier exam that's coming up in two weeks.'
'speaker_A': 'And I I finish writing a proposal and submit it to the committee.'
'speaker_A': 'And uh, should I should I explain, uh, more about what what I'm proposing to do, and s and stuff?'
'speaker_A': 'I'm proposing to do a n a new p approach to speech recognition using um, a combination of, uh, multi band ideas and ideas, um,'
'speaker_A': 'about the uh, acoustic phonec phonetic approach to speech recognition.'

'speaker_A': 'Um, so I will be using these graphical models that um, that implement the multi band approach to recognize a set of intermediate categories that might involve, uh, things like phonetic features or other other f feature things that are more closely related to the acoustic signal itself.'
'speaker_A': 'Um, and the hope in all of this is that by going multi band and by going into these, um intermediate classifications,'
'speaker_A': 'that we can get a system that's more robust to to unseen noises, and situations like that.'
'speaker_A': 'some of the research issues involved in this are, um,'
'speaker_A': 'one, what kind of intermediate categories do we need to classify?'
'speaker_A': 'what other types of structures in these multi band graphical models should we consider in order to um, combine evidence from the sub bands?'
'speaker_A': 'And, uh, the third one is how do we how do we merge all the, uh, information from the individual'
'speaker_A': 'uh, multi band classifiers to come up with word word recognition or or phone recognition things.'
'speaker_A': 'Um, so basically that's that's what I've been doing.'
'speaker_A': 'I got two weeks to brush up on d um, presentation stuff and, um,'
'speaker_D': 'Oh, I thought you were finishing your thesis in two weeks.'
'speaker_F': 'Are you gonna do any dry runs for your'
'speaker_A': 'I, um I'm I'm gonna do some.'
